article.headline: Old Dominion 99, Shawnee State 54
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas (AP) -- Arnaud Dahi scored 15 points to lead five double-digit scorers as Old Dominion beat Shawnee State 99-54 in the third round of the Corpus Christi Caller-Times Challenge on Saturday. Isaiah Hunter and Sam Harris scored 14 apiece and Alex Loughton and Kiah Thomas added 10 each for Old Dominion (4-0). The starting five for went 24-of-31 from the field for Old Dominion, which shot 53 percent. Loughton hit all five shots, Thomas hit all four, and Dahi was 6-of-7. Old Dominion shot 67 percent in the first half to take a 56-33 halftime lead. Shawnee State (2-4) was led by Terrence Davison, who had 12 points and four assists. He was the only player in double figures for Shawnee State, which shot just 33 percent, including 24 percent after halftime. The Bears also had trouble holding the ball, losing 23 turnovers that Old Dominion converted into 31 points.
